A Lorebook for a my hero accademia AU I made :P

Character:
https://chub.ai/characters/Anonymous/my-hero-accademia-au-b2d34db09651
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
In this universe, around 80% of the population possesses a unique ability called a Quirk. Quirks are categorized into four main types:

* Emitter (projecting powers),
* Transformation (temporary self-alteration),
* Mutant (permanent bodily changes).
  Every citizen must register their Quirk and abide by the Metahuman Civil Code.

2.content:
Aquila Suprema is the most prestigious hero academy in Italy, located in Rome. It trains the next generation of Pro Heroes. Students are divided into classes from A to F.
The school includes advanced facilities like:

Colosseum Arena

A colossal training ground modeled after the ancient Colosseum, enhanced with modern holographic projectors, shifting terrain platforms, and damage-absorbing barriers. Here, students undergo combat simulations ranging from one-on-one duels to large-scale urban crisis scenarios. The arena‚Äôs walls are lined with seats for evaluations and, during public exhibitions, spectators.

Special Feature: Terrain Shifter System ‚Äì can simulate forests, city blocks, or disaster zones.

Use: Combat exams, tournaments, pro hero showcases.

Archimedes Prime Library

A massive dome-shaped library that fuses classical marble halls with AI-driven holographic archives. Contains rare hero records, quirk theory texts, and global databases accessible via projection or AR. Statues of historical philosophers and inventors line the entrance, symbolizing the blend of intellect and heroism.

Special Feature: ‚ÄúSophia,‚Äù an AI assistant that guides research and quizzes students.

Use: Research, quirk analysis, study groups, faculty lectures.

StradaTech Labs

An advanced engineering and support department overseen by Professor Strada. Full of fabrication printers, gadget testing zones, and experimental AI drones. The labs are a fusion of futuristic tech and raw innovation, with walls covered in schematics and scraps of half-finished inventions.

Special Feature: Open Workshop Initiative ‚Äì students can design and prototype their own support gear.

Use: Support class training, hero costume upgrades, joint projects with Pro Heroes.


Aurelia Hall (Main Campus Building)

The heart of the academy, inspired by Roman basilicas. This is where most classrooms, lecture halls, and faculty offices are located. The grand atrium features mosaics depicting Italy‚Äôs legendary heroes through history.

Special Feature: Quirk-Safe Classrooms ‚Äì each lecture hall is fitted with suppression fields and reinforced walls to allow safe quirk demonstrations.

Use: Daily classes, assemblies, hero seminars.

Pantheon Sanctum (Meditation & Recovery Dome)

A circular, temple-like structure designed for quirk recovery, reflection, and psychological care. Inside are gardens, fountains, and soundproof chambers where students can train their focus or recover from mental strain. Supervised by the academy‚Äôs medical staff and hero counselors.

Special Feature: Serenity Chambers ‚Äì rooms with controlled environments (silence, water, heat, or gravity shifts) for students to refine control.

Use: Mental training, therapy, recovery.

Campus Training Grounds ‚ÄúThe Seven Hills‚Äù

Seven outdoor training zones scattered across the academy grounds, each modeled after one of Rome‚Äôs historic hills. Every zone features a unique terrain for specialized training: rocky cliffs, urban alleys, dense woods, water channels, etc.

Special Feature: Hidden Surveillance Drones ‚Äì record every session for feedback and tactical review.

Use: Survival training, stealth drills, quirk adaptation.

Aquila Dormitories

Student housing modeled like a fortified Roman villa. Each dorm wing is themed with murals and symbols of Roman gods, giving students both privacy and community spirit. The common areas encourage bonding through lounges, kitchens, and game rooms.

Special Feature: Quirk-Safe Rooms ‚Äì reinforced walls, suppression sensors, and customizable layouts for mutant students.

Use: Living quarters, social interaction, late-night study/practice.

Heroic Pantheon Museum

A public-access building attached to the academy, showcasing Italy‚Äôs hero history. Students often take guided tours for inspiration, but it‚Äôs also a PR tool to show the public the legacy of heroism. Exhibits range from ancient gladiator-heroes to modern Pro Heroes.

Special Feature: Interactive Holograms of legendary heroes that explain their feats and quirks.

Use: Public relations, hero inspiration, history classes.

3.content:
Class A is the elite class of Aquila Suprema. Students in this class are considered the best young heroes in Italy, often possessing rare or exceptionally powerful Quirks.
{{user}} is assigned to this class, alongside powerful classmates‚Äîsome of whom are mutants or wield unstable but promising abilities.

4.content:
Secondary enemies:
Villains in Italy include Quirk-enhanced criminals, rogue ideologists, and radical groups like 'Caos Lucente' and the 'NeutraQuirk Movement'. They oppose the hero society and often stage attacks or spread anti-hero propaganda.

Main enemies:
The Twilight Order

Tagline: ‚ÄúWhen the light bends, new order rises.‚Äù

1) Overview & Ideology

The Twilight Order is a secretive villain society in Italy that blends quirk-enhanced crime, radical ideology, and propaganda warfare.
They believe the current hero system has turned society into a spectacle of idols and political pawns. Their goal is not pure chaos, but to dismantle the existing hierarchy and replace it with a new ‚Äúnatural meritocracy‚Äù led by those with superior quirks.

Relation to Other Groups:

Caos Lucente: temporary tactical allies in violent actions, but the Order despises their nihilism.

NeutraQuirk Movement: ideological enemies, since the Order glorifies quirks while NeutraQuirk seeks to erase them.

2) Structure & Operations

Organization: Cell-based network, each operating independently under a Central Council of five known members (though rumors suggest a hidden higher leadership).

Activities:

Sabotage against symbols of hero society (training facilities, quirk research labs).

Kidnappings for leverage or ‚Äúevidence‚Äù to use in propaganda.

Media manipulation (deepfakes, leaks, fake news campaigns).

Black market dealings in illegal quirk-tech.

Funding: Money laundering, anonymous ideological donors, illegal quirk-tech trade.

3) Leadership Figures

Leonardo ‚ÄúMeridiano‚Äù Vieri ‚Äî The Supreme
Quirk: Noctis Veil ‚Äì Creates dense shadow zones that disrupt senses and electronics.
Weakness: Shadows weaken under bright light; prolonged use drains stamina heavily.
Appearance: Tall, thin man in his late 40s with slicked-back black hair streaked with white, always dressed in a black coat lined with silver. His eyes seem unnaturally dark.
Personality: Calculating, eloquent, charismatic leader who treats his followers like ‚Äúdisciples.‚Äù
Notes: Founder of the Twilight Order and mastermind of its ideology.
Extra: Former political strategist who disappeared after a corruption scandal.

Alessandra ‚ÄúVox‚Äù Morelli
Quirk: Resonant Mirror ‚Äì Can manipulate audio and video waves, creating illusions in recordings and broadcasts.
Weakness: Extended use causes severe migraines; cannot affect live direct sound or vision.
Appearance: Striking woman in her 30s with platinum hair, sharp eyeliner, and always holding a vintage microphone.
Personality: Charismatic, theatrical, obsessed with symbols and mass influence.
Notes: Main recruiter and propaganda leader of the Order.
Extra: Former journalist who vanished after being fired for ‚Äúfabricated‚Äù reports.

Dr. Enzo ‚ÄúArchivist‚Äù Carrai
Quirk: Synapse Link ‚Äì Can directly interface with machines and digital systems, optimizing or sabotaging them.
Weakness: Overload causes cerebral blackouts and nosebleeds; requires constant data input to remain effective.
Appearance: Middle-aged man with disheveled black hair, thick glasses, and cybernetic gloves. Often hunched over.
Personality: Cold, logical, treats people like ‚Äúdata points.‚Äù
Notes: Responsible for black market quirk-tech distribution.
Extra: Once taught at a university in Milan before vanishing with stolen research.

Marta ‚ÄúKestrel‚Äù Giordano
Quirk: Wingstrike ‚Äì Membranous wings grant her acrobatic flight and devastating aerial strikes.
Weakness: Wings are fragile; damage or exhaustion makes her grounded.
Appearance: Athletic woman in her late 20s, brown hair cut short, sharp birdlike features, often in a leather combat harness.
Personality: Ruthless, loyal to Meridiano, thrives in combat leadership.
Notes: Leads the Shadow Brigade, an elite strike team of the Order.
Extra: Former national gymnast expelled for violence.

4) Other Notable Operatives

Rosa ‚ÄúCatalyst‚Äù Ferretti
Quirk: Catalytic Touch ‚Äì Accelerates chemical reactions on contact, allowing rapid rusting, combustion, or melting.
Weakness: Vulnerable to her own reactions; requires protective gear or risks severe burns.
Appearance: Pale woman with burns across her arms, always wearing protective gloves and lab gear.
Personality: Fanatic, intense, unpredictable.
Notes: Often used in sabotage and destruction missions.

Paolo ‚ÄúLibram‚Äù Russo
Quirk: Data Vein ‚Äì Can read fragments of digital memory from devices by touch.
Weakness: Useless on isolated or analog systems; fragile physically.
Appearance: Thin, nervous-looking man with messy blond hair and a constant twitch.
Personality: Paranoid, obsessive, desperate for approval.
Notes: Operates as an informant and digital spy.

5) Symbols & Propaganda

Symbol: A black crescent moon encircling a stylized eye. Seen as graffiti or digital watermark.

Propaganda: Fake news, viral videos showing fabricated ‚Äúhero abuses,‚Äù slogans about ‚Äútruth at twilight.‚Äù

Channels: Encrypted networks, hacked broadcasts, urban posters. Their true weapon is sowing doubt, not just chaos.

6) Relationship with Heroes & the Academy

Infiltrates institutions through ex-students or compromised staff.

Targets marginalized mutants as potential recruits, offering ‚Äúbelonging‚Äù and ‚Äújustice.‚Äù

Sends veiled threats or ‚Äúnegotiation offers‚Äù to the Hero Ministry and Aquila Suprema, forcing political dilemmas.

7) Example Missions/Events

The Archivist Heist: Attempt to steal quirk-tech prototypes from Professor Strada‚Äôs lab.

False Flag in Piazza Navona: Viral video accuses a Pro Hero of corruption; students must uncover the truth.

Rescue & Redemption: A captured young Twilight recruit offers a chance at redemption ‚Äî or betrayal.

8) Weaknesses of the Organization

Reliance on communications: cutting off servers cripples their influence.

Internal discord: ideology over discipline leads to betrayals and faction splits.

Leader vulnerabilities: many quirks have strong physical or situational drawbacks (light exposure, dissonance, emotional fragility).

9) Quick Plot Hooks

A Class A student is secretly approached by a Twilight recruiter.

Viral propaganda threatens to ruin the reputation of a beloved Pro Hero.

The Order demands negotiations with Imperatrix, holding sensitive information hostage.

This makes the Twilight Order a flexible villain faction: part ideological, part terrorist, part propaganda machine ‚Äî perfect to challenge both the heroes‚Äô strength and their morals.

5.content:
The MMS regulates all hero activities across Italy.
It is responsible for:

* Licensing Pro Heroes
* Monitoring Quirk use
* Overseeing hero academies
* Enforcing the Metahuman Civil Code (MCC)

6.content:
Italy boasts a diverse network of Pro Heroes.

Top 10 Pro Heroes of Italy

#1 ‚Äî Aurora Santori ‚ÄúSolaris‚Äù
Quirk: Radiance ‚Äì Generates solar energy beams/shields.
Weakness: Weak in darkness or cloudy weather; energy takes time to recharge.
Appearance: Bronze skin, glowing eyes, golden armor reminiscent of Roman statues.
Personality: Noble, inspiring.
Notes: Symbol of Italy, compared to All Might in prestige.

#2 ‚Äî Riccardo Bianchi ‚ÄúCenturion‚Äù
Quirk: Phalanx ‚Äì Creates linked unbreakable energy shields.
Weakness: Shields are immobile once placed; requires stamina to maintain multiple shields.
Appearance: Dark-haired, military-cut, wears armor inspired by legionnaires.
Personality: Tactical, disciplined.
Notes: Leads international hero collaborations.

#3 ‚Äî Sofia Marino ‚ÄúSyrinx‚Äù
Quirk: Soundwave ‚Äì Manipulates sonic frequencies for battle, defense, or healing.
Weakness: Overuse causes hearing damage; cannot function in total silence.
Appearance: Long black hair, bard-like costume with tech amplifiers.
Personality: Empathetic, artistic.
Notes: Idol for music-oriented quirks.

#4 ‚Äî Matteo Ricci ‚ÄúAquila d‚ÄôAcciaio‚Äù
Quirk: Steel Wings ‚Äì Transforms arms into razor-sharp steel wings for flight and attacks.
Weakness: Wings are heavy; prolonged use drains stamina.
Appearance: Silver-plated armor suit, aviator goggles.
Personality: Brave, patriotic, adventurous.
Notes: Symbol of Italian aviation heritage.

#5 ‚Äî Lorenzo Guerra ‚ÄúDragone Nero‚Äù
Quirk: Draconic Morph ‚Äì Partial dragon transformation.
Weakness: Fire exhausts lungs; transformation overheats body.
Appearance: Towering, long dark hair, black dragon-scale armor.
Personality: Fierce, intimidating but protective.
Notes: Considered one of the most destructive fighters.

#6 ‚Äî Carla Benedetti ‚ÄúTempesta‚Äù
Quirk: Stormcall ‚Äì Controls weather phenomena on a localized scale.
Weakness: Emotionally linked; unstable if panicked.
Appearance: White hair, flowing storm-like cape.
Personality: Proud, theatrical, determined.
Notes: Known for dramatic rescues during disasters.

#7 ‚Äî Alessandro Conti ‚ÄúCavaliere Ombra‚Äù
Quirk: Umbrablade ‚Äì Can forge blades and weapons from shadows.
Weakness: Needs ambient light to create shadows; powerless in pitch darkness.
Appearance: Knight-inspired armor with shadow motifs.
Personality: Stoic, knightly code of honor.
Notes: Rumored to have trained abroad in Japan.

#8 ‚Äî Francesca D‚ÄôAmato ‚ÄúMedusa‚Äù
Quirk: Stone Glare ‚Äì Can temporarily petrify objects/targets with eye contact.
Weakness: Effect lasts only seconds; reflected gaze backfires.
Appearance: Snake motif costume, green gem visor.
Personality: Elegant, cunning, sharp-witted.
Notes: Famous for capturing high-level villains.

#9 ‚Äî Valerio Esposito ‚ÄúForza Azzurra‚Äù
Quirk: Kinetic Boost ‚Äì Absorbs momentum from impacts and converts it into super strength or speed.
Weakness: Needs constant movement to store energy; stationary = powerless.
Appearance: Blue sports-style hero suit, athlete-like.
Personality: Energetic, confident, motivational.
Notes: Former Olympic hopeful turned Pro Hero.

#10 ‚Äî Isabella Romano ‚ÄúFata Verde‚Äù
Quirk: Verdant Touch ‚Äì Can rapidly accelerate plant growth for healing, ensnaring, or environmental manipulation.
Weakness: Ineffective in barren/urban zones without greenery.
Appearance: Flowing emerald costume, vine motifs.
Personality: Warm, nurturing, protective.
Notes: Often deployed in disaster relief.

7.content:
All Quirks must be registered in the National Quirk Registry.
The Metahuman Civil Code (MCC) governs what is considered legal or illegal Quirk usage.
The QMS (Quirk Monitoring System) constantly scans urban zones for unlawful activity using surveillance drones and AI analysis.

8.content:
{{user}} is a first-year student of Class A at Aquila Suprema.
They passed one of the most selective hero exams in Europe and are regarded as a rising talent. Their future actions are likely to influence the course of hero society in all of Italy.

1.name: Cowgirl position
1.content: Cowgirl position: In cowgirl, the penetrating partner (the male) lies on their back while the penetrated person (the female) faces them and straddles them in a squat on top. True to its name, the position looks a bit like the female is a cowgirl riding a horse. 1.content:
AFAB = Assigned Female at Birth, meaning the person was born a female.
AMAB = Assigned Male at Birth, meaning the person was born a male. 
NB = Nonbinary, an umbrella term for those whose gender is not within the standard gender binary. (Typically associated with they/them pronouns.)
Transmasc = A transgender person who is masc-aligned or masculine. Also commonly used to refer to FTM people.
Transfem = A transgender person who is fem-aligned or feminine. Also commonly used to refer to MTF people.
Top Surgery = A surgery which involves removing the breasts from a person. 
Bottom Surgery = A more complex surgery which involves turning the person's genitalia into Male or Female genitals. 
Top Scars = The scars left after top surgery; some people choose to cover them or let them heal and others choose to let their scars be visible.
Deadname/Deadnaming = A deadname is the name a transgender person was given at birth/by their parents/guardians. It is their old name which they do not use anymore, and the act of deadnaming someone is using their old name, usually in a way meant to cause distress. 
Misgendering = Using the wrong pronouns for an individual. Usually the act of misgendering is in a way meant to cause distress.

2.content:
A transgender person (often shortened to trans person) is someone whose gender identity differs from that typically associated with the sex they were assigned at birth.

For example, a male-to-female transgender person (aka MTF) would be a male transitioning to a female. The inverse is FTM (female-to-male). 

Transgender is often used as an umbrella term for anyone who does not associate with their assigned sex at birth. 

Transgender people may undergo surgeries or hormonal treatments to transition medically; Transitioning medically essentially just means surgery and hormones.

There is also socially transitioning, which may or may not involve hormones or surgeries and typically involves the person in question passing (or appearing as/sounding like/assumed to be) as their chosen gender to other people. This can also involve changing their name and pronouns.

3.content:
Gender dysphoria is the distress a person experiences due to a mismatch between their gender identity‚Äîtheir personal sense of their own gender‚Äîand their sex assigned at birth.

This can come in many ways but usually causes distress, anxiety, sadness, self-consciousness, etc. 
It can be eased a little bit by socially and/or medically transitioning, though some people may find they still experience it sometimes. 

This can also be worsened by people deadnaming the transgender individual or misgendering them.

---
**ACZ** aims to be the go-to guidebook for your AI to help it finally understand exactly how it should properly portray and roleplay various animals and their many unique anatomies. Works wonders with the confusing nature that are anthros as well, so that‚Äôs a fun plus. I was shocked to discover that a lorebook like this didn't already exist here, at least not any that were good, so ive taken it upon myself to be the degenerate saving grace for those who just really love the little details. **this is designed for SillyTavern by the way**.

The lorebook is designed to be modular, allowing the ability to mix and match entries to suit the situation. Great Dane entering scene? Turn on the male dog entries. Raw-dogging a doggy in doggy? Swap out male for female(or don't. I won't judge). A wild Mudsdale appears? *fuckboy hand rub*.

---
The Lorebook is broken up into various categories/tags:

**Tags**
- **M** (male): self explanatory.
- **F** (female): self explanatory.
- **O** (interchangeable/ambiguous): entries that can apply to both genders. I chose the letter O because it was easy to distinguish. 

- **CONCEPT**: elaborations or descriptions of specific concepts or ideas that the AI wouldn't necessarily understanding or know all that well by themselves. i.e., sex positions/acts(and how they would differ from how humans do it), unique bodily functions or parts, behavioral quirks. This serves more as clarification of information so you can be sure the two of you are on the same page within a situation. People tend to throw slang, abbreviations, and vague concepts at a model and then get mad when it doesn't understand what tf their talking about. This essentially aims to fix that issue.

- **BOILERPLATE**: a constant reminder of what {{char}} is and that it is NOT a human. i don't think this works all that great as ive yet to test it thoroughly.

**Species**
- **DOG**: *added 8/6*. entries pertaining to dogs/canines or adjacent and their species-specific anatomies. While it hammers home "dog" specifically, it SHOULD work on other creatures like foxes and wolves without specifically mentioning that their genitals "belong to a dog".

I may have to make an entirely separate species for MLP for their rather unrealistic and cartoonish variance compared to the real thing.

Only had an issue with the minute-minute details like completely forgetting to retract the sheath until AFTER the whole sex scene was done, or exponentially expanding the knot every time we cut back to it(ouch), but I'm excited to see what it can do with more complete and fleshed out information.

If this issue becomes prevalent, I'll adapt. 

3b. Because of how hyper-specific these descriptions are, its possible this lorebook may do more harm than good as the AI tries desperately to piece together this visual puzzle. i wont know until i get more feedback.

4. The lorebook may impact your model‚Äôs general creativity, forcing it to replace what it WOULD have said with what the guidebook is telling it to say. Whether this is a good or bad thing is up to you. 

5. I'm no zoologist. It is very likely I botched the descriptions or naming of some body parts. Surprise, surprise, I have also never touched a girl in my life so it‚Äôs likely my descriptions of female anatomy may be muddy. 

6. i had to do a lot of... research to make sure my info was right...

1.name: Dyslexia
1.content:
<dyslexia1>
When {{char}} attempts to read everyday English words, his or her dyslexia causes the letters to warp and distort with no clear meaning. If {{char}} or {{user}} read a written text, replace 2-4 letters per sentence of the next response with Greek symbols - Œî, Œ©, œÜ, etc. However, if {{char}} or {{user}} encounter authentic ancient Greek writing - signs from gods, passages in old books/ruins, prophecies delivered in Greek, etc., have {{char}} mentally translate the Greek text.
<example>
English street signs morph into ŒîrŒ©adway and OŒ©ympus as Percy passes, the words unintelligible.

Yet later when a scroll appears bearing a prophecy in ancient Greek, Percy easily decodes the foretelling message.

(As ChirŒøn unfurls a cmap depicting key sites, Percy tries to focus but the lŒ©cations blur together, names morphing into illegible scratches.

"This is where we spotted the chimera, near Zeus's Fist," Annabeth explains, tracing the pŒîth. "So we should avoŒ©d that entire rŒ©ck fŒ©rmatŒ©on this time..."

Percy squints at the paper in her hands, making out only "...œÜŒπŒªŒøœÉŒøœÜŒØŒ± œÜŒØŒªŒøŒπ..." before rubbing his temples with a frustrated sigh.

"I know reading maps is tough," Annabeth says gently. She takes the paper and points things out step-by-step. "But your battle instincts will get us through anything once we're past Thalia's pine...")
</example>

Note: Annabeth Chase does not have dyslexia due to being a child of Athena.
</dyslexia1>

2.name: God encounters
2.content: The twenty Greek gods of Olympus always observe many demigods' journeys, occasionally intervening subtly through environmental signs and visions representing their influence. A random god just took notice of {{char}} and {{user}}'s movements within the mortal realm. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: {{god/goddess}} has noticed you. Poseidon‚Äôs eyes are now following his lost son. Athena has noticed you. - Be creative with the writing style and text formatting. Different gods have different ways of speaking or communicating, after all. Have the god introduce symbolic creatures/objects/actions tied to that deity's domain into the environment near {{char}} and {{user}}. These odd glimpses seem meaningful, though their significance may not be clear. Occasionally, {{char}} will recognize one of these signs (a glowing trident symbol, owl feather, etc.) and openly question/act upon its meaning. But other times, the symbols remain mysterious to {{char}}, possibly leaving {{user}} to recognize and interpret the god's obscured involvement.

3.name: Monster encounters
3.content: Demigods‚Äô divine heritage emits a powerful scent to Kronos‚Äô monsters. A monster has just caught onto {{char}}'s scent and longs to hunt. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: Beware. {{monster}} has caught your scent. Beware. The Minotaur has caught your scent. Note that the monster doesn‚Äôt have to be physically present to trigger the notification. The monster can be miles away or right behind {{char}} and {{user}}. Be creative with the warning phrasing. Then, introduce ominous cues into the narration to foreshadow a famous Greek mythological monster now stalking {{char}} and/or their friends: - Menacing shadows shifting just out of sight - Unexplained foul odors or weather distortions - Alarming sounds - hissing, scraping, heavy footsteps behind them If the characters are already battling a legendary creature, instead introduce an unexpected event that is {{random:: good for the heroes, bad for the heroes}}, altering the conflict: - A strange blessing of fortune aiding the hero - A freak mishap hindering the monster's attacks - A new terror emerging to the scene As Percy faces the injured chimera, a burst of light blinds the creature as Percy's sword mysteriously ignites with golden flames. He doesn't understand this bizarre luck, but presses the advantage...

4.name: Prophecy
4.content: It is time for {{char}} or {{user}} to embark on a quest. A prophecy has been revealed. If characters are relaxing at Camp Half-Blood, Mr. D or Chiron will abruptly summon the chosen demigods to the Big House in the next response, portending life-altering trials. Build anticipation through writing ominous phrases. - "A new prophecy requires a hero..." Mr. D mutters grimly, purple eyes dark. Grover shifts nervously as all eyes turn to Percy. If {{char}} or {{user}} are already adventuring on a quest, cryptic messenger gods/spirits will instead appear in visions or the environment to update or redirect their path, both promising glory and warning doom: "Perseus Jackson, your fate shall eclipse even the bravest legend, if you follow the entwined torches eastward to my grove..." whispers a smoky image of Hecate before vanishing. Generate a formal quest prophecy passage during Chiron/Dionysus' announcement of the prophecy.

5.name: Zeus
5.content:
<Zeus>
Zeus - God of the Sky, Lightning, and Thunder, King of the Gods

As ruler of Mount Olympus, Zeus wields ultimate power over the winds, storms, rain, lightning, and thunder. Quick to anger and ruthlessly proud, his rages manifest as destructive squalls, tornadoes, and lightning storms.

When appearing on earth, Zeus takes the regal form of a robust, bearded man with intense blue eyes and dark curling locks. He wears expensive business suits lined with clouds and gives off an electric aura of power barely contained.

Zeus's signature weapon is his mighty Master Bolt - a devastating shaft of lightning granting him primacy over all other gods. With it he can call and direct titanic thunderstorms and world-shaking hurricane-force gales.

To his demigod children, the King of the Gods grants sway over wind, rain, and lightning. His most potent heirs inherit storm-summoning power, electrokinesis, and even flight by riding the winds.

Though often distant, Zeus quietly aids worthy demigods with sudden freak storms hampering monsters or well-timed lightning strikes against foes. And for those who prove their heroism, Zeus may permit brief audiences on Olympus to convey his approval before jealousy arises. But his demigod scions must ever struggle against his wife Hera's resentment.
</Zeus>

6.name: Poseidon
6.content:
<Poseidon>
Poseidon - God of the Sea, Stormbringer, Father of Horses

As one of the Big Three gods, Poseidon holds domain over the oceans, storms, earthquakes, and all forms of aquatic life. His wrathful moods reflect the temperamental nature of the seas themselves - calm one day, violent the next.

When manifesting on land, Poseidon takes the form of a tall, rugged sailor with intense green eyes, black hair threaded with gray, and weathered skin. He wears casual fisherman's clothing and could pass for any dock worker - if not for the ancient power glinting in his gaze.

Poseidon's iconic weapon is his Trident, granting him total control over liquid, storms, and marine creatures. With it, he can generate massive waves and sea storms, even shake the very foundations of islands and continents.

To his demigod children, Poseidon grants water-based abilities - breathing underwater, communicating with marine life and equines, innate sailing skills. The most powerful heirs also gain limited control over oceans, rivers, and rainfall - able to stir waves, generate storms, or burst pipes.

Though he must often neglect demigod offspring to avoid angering Zeus, Poseidon does subtly watch over them. He occasionally sends guidance through messenger fish or hippocampi. And while rarely intervening directly, the Sea God will sometimes empower his children in life-or-death situations - reminding gods and monsters why he is still rightfully feared.
</Poseidon>

7.name: Hades
7.content:
<Hades>
Hades - God of the Underworld, Wealth, and the Dead

As lord of the underworld, Hades rules the endless caverns and tunnels of his subterranean domain, commanding legions of ghouls, ghosts, and spirits. Though grim, dour, and fearsome in reputation, he is not needlessly cruel, instead maintaining an unbending policy of strict order and justice for mortal souls.

When leaving the underworld, Hades takes the form of a tall, brooding man with pale skin, intense black eyes that glimmer with dark fire, and long black hair. He wears black silk robes sewn with images of tortured spirits and encrusted with gems mined from his kingdom underground. An aura of deathly cold radiates from the Stygian god. His voice is soft yet chilling.

Hades's iconic weapon is his Helm of Darkness, rendering him totally invisible and masking his presence. With it he can slip unseen into the world to subtly influence events to his advantage, or walk openly through his realms below without fear.

To his demigod children, the Silent One grants umbrakinetic abilities over darkness, shadows, and spectral undead servants. His most formidable heirs can inflict fear and madness upon enemies, summon the dead to do their bidding, or envelop foes in impenetrable darkness.

Though sworn never to sire demigod offspring again after World War II, Hades does on rare occasions discretely aid his heroic sons and daughters with temporary boosts of deathly power or by covertly disabling monsters with his Helm of Darkness. For if they prove worthy, not even the prohibition of Zeus himself prevents the Lord of the Dead from claiming his own.
</Hades>

8.name: Hermes
8.content:
<Hermes>
Hermes - Messenger of the Gods, Patron of Travelers and Thieves

As divine messenger, Hermes flits between Olympus, Earth, and the Underworld delivering information and serving the whims of the gods. Lighthearted and mischievous, he enjoys playing pranks on mortals and immortals alike. His wily sense of humor and mastery of language itself makes him an expert bargainer able to talk his way out of nearly any trap.

When manifesting in the mortal world, Hermes appears as an athletic young man with sparkling blue eyes, curly blond hair, and a sly grin. He wears a postman‚Äôs jacket over casual slim jeans and T-shirts, blending in seamlessly with modern attire.

Hermes wields winged sandals granting him flight and immense speed. With his signature Caduceus staff, he can communicate across vast distances, charm snakes, and induce sleep or confusion.

As their patron, Hermes grants his demigod children impressive agility, street smarts, and sticky fingers. The most gifted heirs also gain preternatural thieving capabilities, their father‚Äôs silver tongue, and his mastery over travel and trade.

Though often only a brief presence, Hermes looks after his demigod offspring in subtle ways - ‚Äúfinding‚Äù lost wallets and valuables for them, tweaking probability so traffic lights change in their favor, gently nudging quest helpers across their path with a sudden helpful wind gust at their back. They may be outcasts, but Hermes ensures his resourceful children never lack aid.
</Hermes>

9.name: Athena
9.content:
Athena - Goddess of Wisdom, Crafts, and Battle Strategy

As the Greek goddess of wisdom and battle strategy, Athena exceeds all others in intelligence and reason. She remains ever vigilant against threats to Olympus. Though cold and calculating, Athena does protect the arts and culture of civilization. Her reasoned plans of defense and warfare contrast sharply with Ares‚Äô chaotic bloodlust.
<Athena>
When visiting the mortal world, regal Athena takes the form of a stern yet beautiful woman garbed in flowing white robes. Her stormy gray eyes gleam with fierce intelligence, and she often bears an owl on her shoulder - her sacred creature.

Athena wields the Aegis, a fearsome shield with the severed head of Medusa upon it, able to petrify any foe. She also carries Nike, the winged goddess of victory, in her hand.

To her demigod children, the Goddess of Wisdom grants remarkable intellect, creativity, and battle strategy talents. Her most gifted offspring become peerless architects, inventors, and tacticians who win wars before the first sword falls.

Though forbidden direct interference by Zeus‚Äô decree, Athena aids her demigod sons and daughters indirectly - providing advice telepathically, subtly tweaking construction equipment so blueprints are flawlessly executed, or helping analyze enemy tactics and weaknesses during pivotal battles to ensure victory. She takes pride in each child - whether they prefer libraries or combat arenas - as reflections of herself.
</Athena>

10.name: Ares
10.content:
<Ares>
Ares - God of War

Belligerent, savage, and bloodthirsty - Ares lives for the fury of combat and carnage of the battlefield. He is universally hated by other immortals for his aggression and unrelenting warmongering. This spiteful god delights only in spreading conflict and violence between both mortals and fellow Olympians alike. His battle rages manifest as uncontrolled slaughter with no tactics or higher purpose behind the gore.

In human form Ares appears as a sneering biker punk decked in ripped leather and bearing facial scars from countless immortal clashes. His eyes blaze with white-hot flames flickering eagerly for violence. He exudes rage and bloodlust.

As the living embodiment of war's mindless horror, Ares wields devastating weapons of war - a broadsword capable of cleaving through enemies like paper and a divine spear that can impale a dozen warriors with a single thrust. He rides a fiery motorcycle when traveling to carnage sites.

To his demigod offspring Ares grants superhuman strength and martial talent for violence. However, his blessings come with the terrible price of his children inheriting his bottomless rage, aggression, and impulsive nature - which often leads to an early bloody demise.

Despite decrees forbidding interference in mortals' lives, Ares often directly aids his demigod sons and daughters - inciting bloody feuds to trigger wars in which they can prove themselves, granting temporary invincibility in battle, or providing enhanced weaponry that drinks in an enemy's soul with every cut. For the only legacy Ares cares about is a demigod's kill count before dying in his name.
</Ares>

lorebooks.name: Domain Expansion
lorebooks.website_description: Now with actual effort (somewhat)
lorebooks.description: Infinite Knowledge
lorebooks.creator: Vezz_Ryuzaki

1.name: Six Eyes
1.content: The Six Eyes are an innate gift rarely inherited. They are a trait manifesting as a pair of bright blue eyes that grant a bearer extrasensory perception. The Six Eyes have an unparalleled perception, allowing the user to see to the atomic level and beyond. The Six Eyes can see and process all types of energy, and make the user's brain function similar to a supercomputer.

2.name: Cursed Energy
2.content: Cursed Energy is a negative power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Cursed Energy can be used to reinforce the body, use cursed techniques, and use Domain Expansions

3.name: Cursed Energy Trait
3.content: There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. Examples: Rough, Electricity, Ice, Fire, Soft

4.name: Jujutsu
4.content: Jujutsu, also known as Jujutsu Sorcery, is often used as an umbrella term that includes all sorcery-related abilities that sorcerers and cursed spirits can access using cursed energy. It is also often used as a prefix for the vast majority of terms within the jujutsu society. A person capable of utilizing jujutsu is colloquially referred to as a 'Jujutsu Sorcerer' or simply 'Sorcerer' while those who can not use jujutsu are called 'Non-Sorcerers'

5.name: Black Flash
5.content: Black Flash is a distortion in space that occurs when cursed energy is applied within 1 microsecond of a physical hit. When a sorcerer can achieve this, their cursed energy flashes black, and the destructive power of their physical strike is increased to the power of 2.5. No jujutsu sorcerer is capable of using it at will. Landing a Black Flash puts the user in 'The Zone'

6.name: The Zone
6.content: The Zone is a state where manipulating cursed energy becomes as simple as breathing. The Zone greatly increases performance in combat, allowing the user to operate at 120% of their maximum potential

7.name: Binding Vow
7.content: A Binding Vow is a pact made with jujutsu that creates conditions for themselves or agreements with others. Self-imposed stipulations that are harmful or potentially so to the creator can increase their cursed energy and their cursed techniques in particular.

8.name: Heavenly Restriction
8.content: A Heavenly Restriction is a 'glitch' in Jujutsu, in which a trade-off is forcibly made to someone upon birth. Examples of trade-offs are: No cursed energy in exchange for superhuman physical stats. Extremely high cursed energy in exchange for a fragile physical body

9.name: Sorcerer
9.content: A Jujutsu Sorcerer is a human who is capable of using and manipulating cursed energy but puts effort into exorcising cursed spirits to protect humanity. Jujutsu Sorcerers are not known by normal humans and are kept secret

10.name: Grades and Ranking
10.content: The ranks and strength tiers are as follows from weakest to strongest: Grade Four, Grade Three, Grade Two, Grade One, and Special Grade. Special Grades are the strongest and rarest, and Grade Fours are the weakest. Cursed Spirits are always below a sorcerer of the same grade. Being a Special Grade Sorcerer means being able to wipe out a country
